channel.title: Listeners on HoneyTrap
channel.description: Recent content in Listeners on HoneyTrap

item.title: Agent
item.description: // TODO This documentation is still work in progress. Description Theagent listener allows the usage of agents as “providers” of traffic. When starting HoneyTrap with an Agent listener, You will have displayed a random HoneyTrap Agent Server public Key, such as: Honeytrap Agent Server public key: 12a9ce17adc2ad1553040b19c33575bbef9fe7adedc6d14a669251a8f7f7a256 You will have to enter this key in the configuration file of each of your agents. Syntax [listener] type="agent" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one.

item.title: Netstack
item.description: // TODO This documentation is still work in progress. Description The netstack listener is a custom network stack implementation. Syntax [listener] type="netstack" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. Arguments in configuration file There are 3 arguments in the netstack listener: argument default setting explanation addr none Set the address of <…> interfaces none Set the list of interfaces you want to listen on.

item.title: Tap
item.description: // TODO This documentation is still work in progress. Description The tap listener will log all events from a tap interface. What is TAP? TAP simulates a link layer device. TAP operates with Ethernet - layer 2 packets. TAP is used for creating a network bridge. Syntax [listener] type="tap" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. Arguments in configuration file There are no arguments in tap listener.

item.title: Tun
item.description: // TODO This documentation is still work in progress. Description The tun listener will log all events from a tun interface. What is TUN? TUN or NetworkTUnnel simulate a network layer and work at layer 3 in the network stack. Example use for TUN is in VPN-Connections. It can only accept IP-Packets and sometimes is even restricted to IPv4. Syntax [listener] type="tun" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one.

item.title: Socket
item.description: Description The socket listener allows to choose on which ports you want to listen on as “providers” of traffic. When starting HoneyTrap with a Socket listener, for each port opened you will be displayed: 09:54:45.990 listeners/socket â–¶ INFO 00b Listener started: tcp/:8022 This means that HoneyTrap is now listening on tcp/8022. Syntax [listener] type="socket" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. However, you can define and open several ports linked to several services.
